bug.short_desc: showcase: internal modal window remains when changing to new tab

long_desc.thetext:
In showcase (http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/showcase/#InternalWindow) click on "Open modal dialog 1". The modal (internal) window will open. Now click on a different tab, e.g. Themes. Note that the modal (internal) window is displayed over the new tab's canvas.
One of two things should (instead) have happened:
1. The fact that it's a modal window should have prevented selecting a different tab
or
2. Modal internal windows are deemed to be tab (canvas) specific, so the modal window should have disappeared when selecting a different tab and then reappear when returning to the tab on which it was created.
It would be great if the user could select the "scope" of modality: either current canvas or global, in order to select between the above two options. In no case I can think of, however, would one expect the current behavior to be appropriate.
Derrell

I could not switch any tabs when opening the modal window. Normally, when a modal window is open, the whole application is blocked. This was also the case when testing here under Windows Vista/Firefox 2
